question: A square loop of side length 'a' is moving away from an infinitely long current carrying conductor at a constant speed 'v' as shown. Let 'x' be the instantaneous distance between the long conductor and side AB. The mutual inductance (M) of the square loop - long conductor pair changes with time (t) according to which of the following graphs?
images/q2_diagram.png
explanation: Mutual inductance <katex>$M$</katex> depends on the flux <katex>$\phi$</katex> through the loop per unit current.
The magnetic field <katex>$B$</katex> due to the long wire is inversely proportional to distance (<katex>$B \propto 1/r$</katex>).
As the loop moves away, the distance <katex>$x = vt$</katex> increases, so the flux decreases non-linearly (logarithmic dependence).
Therefore, <katex>$M$</katex> decreases with time <katex>$t$</katex> in a non-linear decay fashion, which corresponds to graph A.
